etymologies: mid 17th century: from Latin salivat- ‘(having) produced saliva’, from the verb salivare, from saliva (see saliva)

definitions: secrete saliva, especially in anticipation of food

examples.text: the delicious aroma of rich stews made us salivate

definitions: cause (a person or animal) to produce an unusually copious secretion of saliva.
shortDefinitions: cause person or animal to produce unusually copious secretion of saliva

definitions: display great relish at the sight or prospect of something

examples.text: I was fairly salivating at the prospect of a $10 million loan

shortDefinitions: display great relish at sight or prospect of something
